alert.note: Alert for Kent; Stonewall (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued June 21 at 10:15PM CDT until June 21 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: The National Weather Service in Lubbock Texas has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Southeastern Kent County in northwestern Texas... Southwestern Stonewall County in northwestern Texas... * Until 1100 PM CDT. * At 1014 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 7 miles west of Peacock, or 7 miles southeast of Jayton, moving south at 30 mph. Destructive non-tornadic winds up to 100 mph are also likely with this storm! HAZARD...Tornado and softball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * Locations impacted include... Peacock. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...4.00 IN
info.instruction: Heavy rainfall may hide this tornado. Do not wait to see or hear the tornado. TAKE COVER NOW! This is a dangerous storm, capable of producing giant hail driven by hurricane force winds! SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows! If you are caught outdoors, cover your head and neck.
